title: Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Living Room", August 6, 1934
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/501 MADISON AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower right: LIVING ROOM FOR MR. & MRS.GEORGE RAND/46 WASHINGTON MEWS - NEW YORK CITY; inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 520-3/ 1/2"=1'0"/ R.K. DuM/ 9/6/34; dimensions, schedule, and materials inscribed in graphite
description: Plan and elevations for living room. Expansive window on north wall of living room with door at center; new radiators at each side of door. Ascending staircase at west wall with entrance near north wall. Door on far left of west wall. Fireplace at center of east wall; area surrounding fireplace in Bakelite, soapstone hearth, and wood mantel. Shelving unit at left of fireplace with four shelves above a two-door cabinet. Curved sofa in the south east corner of room; dark brown cork tile on wall above sofa and reflector strip behind sofa. Glass brick wall and curtain track on south wall.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Living Room", August 6, 1934.
August 6, 1934. Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-535.
